entry.title: Combined summary - Missing fRelayTxes in version
entry.summary: The discussion centers around the Bitcoin protocol's version message and whether it should indicate which fields are present to simplify parsing. Some argue that a new field should only be added if there is an actual need for it, while others believe that raising the protocol version number to indicate all required fields would simplify things. The debate also touches on the issue of optional fields and how they should be handled. While some suggest indicating different formats for messages or having a bitfield to show which fields are present, others argue that using a quirk of an implementation is bad form and sloppy coding. There is also a suggestion to check the length of the version message for consistency in the software. Despite differing views, many agree that increasing the protocol version number would be a minor but reasonable change.
